medical_history.chief_complaint: Failure to thrive observed in infancy, associated with neonatal salt wasting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth, with the first child showing failure to thrive and dehydration at 2-3 months old, and later, severe symptoms at 9 months. The second child exhibited severe symptoms including vomiting and dehydration at 8 days old. Rapid weight gain occurred without treatment initially, but symptoms persisted and worsened over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The index child was diagnosed with pseudohypoaldosteronism type 1 (PHA1) confirmed by genetic testing.
medical_history.family_history: The father and an older sister reported increased salt appetite, with the father having a history of poor weight gain during infancy. Both mutations related to PHA1 were transmitted within the family.
